name: Upload Custom SecurityTip Graphics
title: Upload Custom SecurityTip Graphics
body:
If your organization uses SecurityCoach, you can upload custom SecurityTip graphics to use in real-time coaching campaigns. You can use these graphics to coach your users about risky activity and how to avoid it in the future.

Important:Custom SecurityTips used in real-time coaching campaigns are available to your users for seven days after the SecurityTip is sent.

Creating a Custom SecurityTip

To create a custom SecurityTip, follow the steps below:

  1. Log in to your KSAT console.
  2. Navigate to SecurityCoach > SecurityTips.
  3. Click + New SecurityTip.
  4. Fill out the fields for your custom SecurityTip graphic. For more information, see the screenshot and list below:

    1. Content Title: Enter a descriptive title for your graphic.
    2. Description: Enter a short summary for your graphic.
    3. Thumbnail: Upload a preview image for your graphic. This graphic will be displayed on the SecurityTips subtab next to the graphic's card.

      Note:Thumbnail files must be in JPG or PNG format, no larger than 10 MB, and sized to 500 x 500 pixels or less.
    4. Topics: Select the topics for your graphic. For more information, see our Custom SecurityTip Topics article.
  5. Click the Save button. You'll be redirected to the SecurityTip Details page where you’ll add the language files and upload your custom SecurityTip graphic.

Uploading a Custom SecurityTip Graphic

To upload a custom SecurityTip graphic, follow the steps below:

  1. Click + Add Language.
  2. Fill out the fields for the language file. For more information, see the screenshot and list below:

    1. Alt Text: Enter alternative text (alt text) for your graphic. This text helps improve accessibility for users with screen readers.
    2. Language: Choose the language that applies to your new SecurityTip translation. For more information about our supported languages, see our Localization Guide.

      Important:Ensure that any text in the Alt Text and the Content File matches the language that you select here.
    3. Status: Select Draft or Published. Your language file must be in the Published status before you can use it in real-time coaching campaigns. 
    4. Content File: Select and upload your graphic file. Users will see this graphic when they receive the SecurityTip.

      Note:Files must be smaller than 1 GB.
  3. Click Save to save your language file.
  4. Repeat the steps in this section for any additional language files that you want to add for your custom SecurityTip.

When you save your language file, you’ll be redirected to the SecurityTip Details page. Here, you can view information about your graphic, including a list of your language files, their statuses, and when they were updated.

You can click Edit Content Options to edit the information about your custom SecurityTip and select the default language for your SecurityTip. If you have multiple language files, you can set the default language file for your SecurityTip.

You can view all of your custom graphics by navigating to SecurityTips > Types > Custom. If you would like to edit a custom graphic, you can click Details on the graphic's card. 

Deleting a Custom SecurityTip

You can delete a custom SecurityTip and all its language files, or you can choose to delete a specific language file in your custom SecurityTip.

If you would like to delete a custom SecurityTip that’s been used in a campaign, you’ll need to deactivate the campaign and then archive the SecurityTip. If you would like to delete a custom SecurityTip that’s been used in a deactivated campaign, you’ll need to first delete the associated campaign and then delete the SecurityTip. For information on how to deactivate or delete a campaign, see the Managing and Editing Real-Time Coaching Campaigns section of our Real-Time Coaching Campaigns Guide.

Deleting a Custom SecurityTip

If you’re deleting a custom SecurityTip that’s been used in a campaign, you’ll need to first archive the SecurityTip graphic. Follow the steps below to learn how to archive and delete a custom SecurityTip.

Warning:Deleting a custom SecurityTip is a permanent action and can’t be undone.
  1. Log in to your KSAT console.
  2. Navigate to SecurityCoach > SecurityTips.
  3. From the Types drop-down menu, select Custom.
  4. Find the SecurityTip you want to remove, then click Details.
  5. On the SecurityTip Details page, select Archive.
  6. In the pop-up window that appears, click Confirm.
  7. Click Delete.
  8. In the pop-up window that appears, click Confirm. This action can’t be undone.

Deleting a Custom SecurityTip Graphic File

If you don’t want to delete an entire custom SecurityTip, you can instead delete a specific language file and its associated custom SecurityTip graphic. To delete a custom language file, follow the steps below.

Warning:Deleting a language file is a permanent action and can’t be undone.
  1. Log in to your KSAT console.
  2. Navigate to SecurityCoach > SecurityTips.
  3. From the Types drop-down menu, select Custom.
  4. Find the SecurityTip whose language file you want to remove, then click Details.
  5. On the SecurityTip Details page, find the language file you want to delete.
  6. Click the three dots icon, then click Delete. This action can't be undone.
Important:If only one language file exists, it can't be deleted.

images.alt:
This image displays the "SecurityTips" management interface within a web application.

**Header and Navigation:**
*   The primary title is "SecurityTips."
*   A main navigation bar includes the tabs: "Dashboard," "Real-Time Coaching," "Detection Rules," **"SecurityTips" (currently selected)**, "Setup," and "Reports."
*   Beneath the main navigation, two sub-tabs are present: **"Graphics" (selected)** and "Notification Templates."

**Action Button and Filters:**
*   In the top right, a prominent blue button labeled **"+ New SecurityTip"** allows for content creation. An orange arrow overlay points directly to this button.
*   A filtering section includes four dropdown menus/search fields: "Types (All selected)," "Topics (Select option)," "Languages (Select option)," and a "Search" bar.
*   A "Clear Filters" link is located below the search bar.

**Results Grid:**
*   The current search status is displayed as **"46 Results."**
*   The results are presented in a four-column card grid, showcasing individual security tips.

**Example Content Cards (Left to Right):**

1.  **Image:** A laptop displaying a white skull-and-crossbones (Jolly Roger) icon on a black screen.
    *   **Tags:** "Email Forwarding," "Email Safety."
    *   **Title:** "Caution: Automatically Forwarding Emails May Cause a Data Leak."
    *   **Language:** "English (United States)."
    *   **Actions:** Buttons labeled "Details" and "Create Campaign."

2.  **Image:** A man in a bright green shirt looking intently at a large monitor.
    *   **Tags:** "Social Engineering," "Online Safety."
    *   **Title:** "Bad Actors Create Social Media Accounts to Trick You."
    *   **Language:** "English (United States)."
    *   **Action:** Button labeled "Create Campaign."

3.  **Image:** A graphic depicting tips for securing mobile devices, including text elements like "Securing mobile devices when traveling" and bullet points.
    *   **Tags:** "Network Safety," "Device Safety."
    *   **Title:** "Securing Mobile Devices When Traveling."
    *   **Language:** "English (United States)."
    *   **Action:** Button labeled "Create Campaign."

4.  **Image:** A blue graphic with text "Back up your data!" and an illustration of a laptop connected to cloud storage.
    *   **Tags:** "Data Handling Best Practices."
    *   **Title:** "Back Up Your Data."
    *   **Language:** "English (United States)."
    *   **Action:** Button labeled "Create Campaign."

All listed content cards feature a small document or paper icon next to the language description, suggesting downloadable or linked content.

This image displays the "New SecurityTip Details" interface, a form used for content creation within a security management platform titled **SecurityTips**.

**Interface Context and Navigation:**
The global navigation bar includes links for "Dashboard," "Real-Time Coaching," "Detection Rules," "SecurityTips," "Setup," and "Reports." A directional link in the top right allows navigation "← Back to SecurityTips Catalog."

**Form Details ("New SecurityTip Details"):**
The form requires input for four distinct content attributes, labeled with indicators (a, b, c, d):

1.  **Content Title (a):** A standard single-line text input field.
2.  **Description (b):** A multi-line text area, featuring a visual resize handle in the bottom right corner.
3.  **Thumbnail (c):** A file upload component labeled "Thumbnail." The label includes a help icon (question mark). The input field displays the placeholder "Please select a file..." and is paired with an adjacent "Browse" button.
4.  **Topics (d):** A standard dropdown (select) menu component displaying the placeholder "Select option."

**Action Buttons:**
The interface concludes with two action buttons:
*   **Save:** Primary action button (blue, solid fill).
*   **Cancel:** Secondary action button (gray, solid fill).

images.alt:
This image displays the "SecurityTip Details" interface for managing content metadata and translations within a system environment titled "SecurityTips."

**UI Elements and Context:**

1.  **Navigation:** A link labeled "← Back to SecurityTips Catalog" is located in the upper right corner.
2.  **Detail Section:** The section header is "SecurityTip Details."
    *   A content thumbnail shows a laptop displaying a skull icon.
    *   The tip is titled "New Sec Tip."
    *   A subtitle reads: "This is my first custom graphic!"
    *   Metadata fields include: "Last Updated: 07/21/2023, 1:53 PM" and "Default Language: English (United States)."
    *   An action link, "Edit Content Options" (preceded by a pencil icon), is available.
3.  **Translations Management:** A subsection labeled "Translations" displays a table for managing localized content.
    *   The table contains four column headers: "Language," "Status," "Updated," and "Actions" (all indicated as sortable fields).
    *   The table body is empty, displaying the text: "There are no records to show."
    *   A primary action button, highlighted by an overlaid orange arrow annotation, is located above the table, labeled: **+ Add Language** (blue button).

A UI screenshot displaying the **New Translation** configuration form.

**Header Elements:**
*   Page title: **New Translation** (bold, top left).
*   Navigation link: **← Back to SecurityTip** (top right).

**Form Fields (Labeled and Annotated):**
1.  **Alt Text (a):** A large, multi-line text area for input, currently empty and resizeable via the bottom-right corner.
2.  **Language (b):** A dropdown menu displaying the placeholder text "Select a Language...".
3.  **Status (c):** A dropdown menu pre-populated with the value **Draft**.
4.  **Content File (d):** A file input field composed of a read-only text box displaying "Please select a file..." and an adjacent button labeled **Browse**.

**Action Buttons (Bottom):**
*   **Save:** Primary blue button.
*   **Cancel:** Secondary gray button.

images.alt:
This image displays the detail view for a specific content item within a "SecurityTips" management interface.

**Header and Context:**
*   The page title is "SecurityTips."
*   A navigation link in the top right reads: "← Back to SecurityTips Catalog."
*   The primary section header is "SecurityTip Details."

**Content Metadata:**
*   A thumbnail image shows a laptop displaying a white skull/heart graphic.
*   The content title is "New Sec Tip" with the subtitle "This is my first custom graphic!"
*   Metadata includes: "Last Updated: 07/21/2023, 1:53 PM" and "Default Language: English (United States)."

**UI Actions and Focus:**
*   A blue outlined button, explicitly marked by a large orange arrow, is labeled **"Edit Content Options"** (preceded by a pencil icon).
*   A solid blue button in the upper right of the translation section is labeled **"+ Add Language."**

**Translations Data Table (Highlighted):**
*   The bottom section, labeled "Translations," contains a four-column data table framed by a prominent orange border.
*   Column headers are: **Language** (Sortable), **Status**, **Updated** (Sortable), and **Actions**.
*   The single existing entry details the default language version:
    *   **Language:** English (United States), followed by a gray **Default** tag.
    *   **Status:** A blue **Published** tag.
    *   **Updated:** 07/21/2023, 1:53 PM.
    *   **Actions:** A vertical ellipsis menu icon.

images.alt:
This image displays the **SecurityTips** management interface within a web application, specifically focused on viewing security awareness content (Graphics).

**Header and Primary Navigation:**
The application title is "SecurityTips." The primary navigation bar includes links for Dashboard, Real-Time Coaching, Detection Rules, **SecurityTips** (active tab), Setup, and Reports. A prominent blue action button in the upper right corner is labeled "+ New SecurityTip."

**Sub-Navigation and Filtering:**
Below the primary navigation, two sub-tabs are present: **Graphics** (currently active) and Notification Templates.
The content is filtered using four primary controls:
1.  **Types (Dropdown):** Shows options including All, System, and an active filter tag labeled **Custom**. This tag includes the instructional text: "Press enter to remove." (An orange arrow highlights this active filter tag.)
2.  **Topics (Dropdown):** Placeholder text "Select option."
3.  **Languages (Dropdown):** Placeholder text "Select option."
4.  **Search (Input Field):** An input box labeled "Search" with a magnifying glass icon.
A hyperlink labeled "Clear Filters" is available to reset all search parameters.

**Content Display (Card View):**
Security Tips are presented in a card format, with two examples visible:

1.  **Card 1 (Left):**
    *   Image: A laptop displaying a skull and crossbones (Jolly Roger) on the screen.
    *   Tags: Email Forwarding, Email Safety.
    *   Title: "Caution: Automatically Forwarding Emails May Cause a Data Leak."
    *   Details: Language is specified as "English (United States)," accompanied by a small document icon.
    *   Action Buttons: Two blue buttons are present: **Details** (highlighted by an orange arrow) and Create Campaign.

2.  **Card 2 (Right, Partially Visible):**
    *   Image: Illustration of a person looking at computer screens.
    *   Tags: Social Engineering, Online Safety.
    *   Title: "Bad Actors Create Social Media Accounts to Trick You."
    *   Action Buttons: Details, Create Campaign.
images.context: c, you can click Details on the graphic's card.

images.alt:
This image depicts the user interface of an administrative panel focused on **SecurityTips** management.

**Context and Navigation:**
The top-level navigation identifies the active section as **SecurityTips**, bordered and highlighted among other links: Dashboard, Real-Time Coaching, Detection Rules, Setup, and Reports. A secondary set of content tabs features **Graphics** (currently active/dark gray) and Notification Templates.

**Filter Controls (Types and Topics):**
The interface includes two parallel filter components labeled "Types" and "Topics."

1.  **Types Filter:** This dropdown menu is expanded. The input field displays "Select option." The visible options in the open menu are: "All" (marked "Selected"), "System," and **Custom**. The "Custom" option is currently highlighted with a solid blue background, accompanied by the instruction "Press enter to select."
2.  **Topics Filter:** This dropdown remains closed, displaying "Select option" in the input field.

A large, external orange arrow points toward the lower right corner of the "Types" dropdown menu, adjacent to the "Custom" selection.

This image displays a segment of a user interface showing search results or content recommendations.

**UI Structure and Text Elements:**

1.  **Filtering Section:** The top portion includes the label "Types" followed by a dropdown menu selection displaying the value "**Custom**."
2.  **Results Count:** Below the filter is the bolded text indicating the result total: "**1 Results**."
3.  **Content Card:** A single result card is displayed below the count.
    *   **Image:** The card features a primary visual—a photograph of an open silver laptop with a large, white, stylized skull/hazard symbol displayed against a black screen.
    *   **Tags:** Two functional tags or categories are listed below the image: "**Email Forwarding**" and "**Email Safety**."
    *   **Title:** The main content title is bolded: "**Caution: Automatically Forwarding Emails May Cause a Data Leak**."
    *   **Metadata:** Below the title, the language is specified as "**English (United States)**," accompanied by a small document/page icon on the right.
    *   **Call-to-Action (CTA) Buttons:** The bottom of the card contains two primary blue CTA buttons: "**Details**" (on the left) and "**Create Campaign**" (on the right).

*Note: An external orange arrow is graphically overlaid, pointing toward the area of the CTA buttons, specifically below the "Details" button.*

images.alt:
This is a detail view page within a content management system, titled **"SecurityTip Details"**, under the main application heading **"SecurityTips"**.

**Header and Primary Actions:**
The upper right corner includes a navigational link, **"← Back to SecurityTips Catalog"**, and a primary action link, **"Archive"**.

**SecurityTip Details Section:**
This section displays the core metadata for the content item "New Sec Tip":
*   **Thumbnail:** An image depicting a laptop screen displaying a skull and crossbones graphic.
*   **Title:** **New Sec Tip**
*   **Description:** This is my first custom graphic!
*   **Metadata:** Last Updated: 07/21/2023, 1:53 PM | Default Language: English (United States)
*   **Action Button:** **Edit Content Options** (outlined button with an edit icon).

**Translations Section (Localization Data Grid):**
Below the details, a section titled **"Translations"** displays localized versions of the content. A blue primary button, **+ Add Language**, is present for creating new translations.

The translation data is presented in a grid with four columns: **Language**, **Status**, **Updated**, and **Actions**. Both Language and Updated columns are sortable.

*   **Row 1 (Default):**
    *   Language: English (United States) [Default label]
    *   Status: Published
    *   Updated: 11/08/2023, 12:23 PM
    *   Actions: Vertical ellipsis menu icon.
*   **Row 2:**
    *   Language: Spanish (Latin America)
    *   Status: Published
    *   Updated: 11/08/2023, 12:23 PM
    *   Actions: Vertical ellipsis menu icon.

This image displays the **SecurityTip Details** screen within a content management system.

**Header and Navigation:**
The page title is **SecurityTips**. A top navigation link is present: **← Back to SecurityTips Catalog**. On the far right, a destructive action link is visible: **Delete**.

**SecurityTip Details Section:**
The section is titled **SecurityTip Details**. Content metadata is displayed alongside a thumbnail image (a laptop screen showing a white skull graphic).
*   **Title:** **New Sec Tip**
*   **Description:** This is my first custom graphic!
*   **Metadata:** Last Updated: 07/21/2023, 1:53 PM. Default Language: English (United States).
*   **Action Button:** A button labeled **Edit Content Options** allows modification of the tip's settings.

**Translations Section:**
The **Translations** section manages localized versions of the content. A button **+ Add Language** is available to create new translations.
The section uses a data table with the following columns: **Language**, **Status**, **Updated**, and **Actions**.

**Translation Data:**
1.  **English (United States):** Designated as **Default** (grey tag). The content status is **Archived** (red tag). Last updated on 11/08/2023, 12:33 PM. Actions are available via an ellipsis menu.
2.  **Spanish (Latin America):** Content status is **Archived** (red tag). Last updated on 11/08/2023, 12:33 PM. Actions are available via an ellipsis menu.

The "Custom" option is currently highlighted with a solid blue background, accompanied by the instruction "Press enter to select."

images.alt:
This is a view of the "SecurityTip Details" interface within a content management system, displaying configuration and translation status for a custom asset titled "New Sec Tip."

**UI Structure and Content Details:**

1.  **Header:** The page context is "SecurityTips," with a navigation link in the top right: "← Back to SecurityTips Catalog."
2.  **Asset Details:** The main section is "SecurityTip Details."
    *   It features a thumbnail graphic (a skull icon on a laptop screen).
    *   The asset title is **"New Sec Tip."**
    *   Metadata includes the description: "This is my first custom graphic!"
    *   Timestamps show "Last Updated: 07/21/2023, 1:53 PM."
    *   The asset's default language is "English (United States)."
    *   An action button labeled "Edit Content Options" is present. A prominent, standalone "Delete" link is also available near the top right of this section.
3.  **Translations Table:** A section titled "Translations" lists available language versions. A blue button labeled "+ Add Language" allows adding new translations.
    *   The table contains four columns: Language, Status, Updated, and Actions.
    *   **Row 1 (Default):** "English (United States)" (marked "Default"), Status: "Published," Updated: "11/08/2023, 12:39 PM."
    *   **Row 2:** "Spanish (Latin America)," Status: "Published," Updated: "11/08/2023, 12:39 PM."
4.  **Focused Action Menu:** An orange arrow highlights the context menu (activated by the vertical ellipsis icon) for the "Spanish (Latin America)" translation entry. This dropdown menu provides two options:
    *   **Delete** (accompanied by a trash can icon).
    *   **Preview** (accompanied by an eye icon).
